New Records: Lane Thomas hit a grand slam off Tarik Skubal in the fifth inning, which was Skubal's first ever grand slam allowed.
Cade Smith set a Division Series relief record with 12 strikeouts by a reliever.
Key Match Events: Lane Thomas hit a grand slam in the fifth inning to lead the Guardians to a 7-3 win.
Kerry Carpenter doubled home Riley Greene in the seventh to cut the lead to two runs.
Eli Morgan entered and struck out Wenceel Perez and Spencer Torkelson to strand Keith at second.
Pre-Game Insights: Tigers manager A.J. Hinch emphasized the importance of strong bullpen performance.
The manager highlighted the importance of giving everything they could in a playoff-deciding game.
Post-Match Reflections: Tigers manager A.J. Hinch expressed pride in the team's resilience after the comeback win.
Hinch said the team left everything on the field against a really good team.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game marked the end of the Tigers' incredible season, which ended with a 7-3 loss to the Guardians.
The Tigers missed a chance to make their eighth appearance in the ALCS since the divisional format was created in 1969.
Others: The Tigers will advance to play the New York Yankees in the American League Championship Series beginning Monday night.
